intro: Erythrococca dewevrei, commonly known as the red cocculus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive red, fleshy fruits. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and climbing. The fruit, which is edible when ripe, has a sweet and tart flavor, making it a valued plant in local cuisines.
